intro: Psychotria unicarinata, commonly known as the "Soul of the Forest," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It contains psychoactive alkaloids, including dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which contribute to its significance in traditional spiritual practices. Due to its hallucinogenic properties, it is also of interest in scientific research related to ethnobotany and pharmacology.
